newsitem.title: USA: Isis drug has potential to treat cancer.
newsitem.headline: Isis drug has potential to treat cancer.

text.p: Isis Pharmaceuticals said Tuesday a compound it has developed with Ciba-Geigy AG has shown potential to treat cancer.

Isis said the compound, ISIS 5132/CGP69846A, inhibited the growth of human tumors in animals. Human tumors were transplanted subcutaneously into mice and the drug was administered intravenously in various doses.
The compound was tested alone and also in conjunction with traditional cancer chemotherapeutics.
Isis said in a statement some combinations of the drug with traditional cancer therapies resulted in complete cures of the animals treated.
The company said the results suggest the compound has significant potential as a treatment for cancer used either alone or in combination chemotherapy regimens.

The compound is a selective antisense inhibitor. It binds to a messenger RNA sequence and inhibits the production of the C-raf kianse protein. The company said the compound is in a Phase I clinical trial on cancer patients. Results of that trial are expected by the end of the year.
The company said scientists are continuing to refine the compound to enhance safety and efficiacy.
Shares of Isis were 7/8 higher at 16-1/8 in afternoon trading on Nasdaq.
